Savory Roasted Chicken and Herbed Potato Medley

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a delightful culinary adventure with this Savory Roasted Chicken and Herbed Potato Medley recipe! Perfect for family dinners or special occasions, this dish combines the succulent flavors of roasted chicken with the comforting, earthy taste of herbed potatoes. With just a handful of ingredients, including juicy chicken, tender potatoes, and fragrant herbs, you can create a meal that is not only satisfying but also visually appealing. As the chicken roasts, it releases aromatic juices that infuse the potatoes, creating a harmonious blend of flavors that will have your taste buds dancing with joy. Whether you're an experienced cook or just starting, this recipe is straightforward and sure to impress. Let's dive into the details and get ready to savor every bite!

Ingredients

chicken (whole or parts)

Choose a whole chicken for more flavor and juiciness, but if using parts, consider a mix of thighs and breasts for variety. If you prefer a leaner option, you can use skinless chicken. For a vegetarian option, consider marinated tofu or chickpeas, though cooking times will vary.

potatoes (baby or small)

Baby potatoes are great for roasting as they cook evenly and have a creamy texture. If unavailable, you can substitute with regular potatoes cut into quarters. For a lower-carb option, swap with cauliflower florets, but adjust cooking time as they cook faster.

olive oil

Use extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor, but you can substitute with avocado oil or melted butter for a different taste. If you’re looking to cut calories, use a light spray of cooking oil instead.

garlic (minced)

Fresh garlic gives the best flavor, but you can use garlic powder in a pinch (1/8 teaspoon per clove). To mellow the flavor, roast the garlic before adding it to the chicken mix.

dried thyme

Dried thyme works well, but fresh thyme can provide a more vibrant flavor. Use about three times the amount if substituting. For a different profile, try using dried oregano or Italian seasoning.

dried rosemary

Dried rosemary can be quite potent, so ensure it's crushed or chopped finely to release its flavor. If you have fresh rosemary, it can enhance the dish remarkably; use 2-3 times the amount. Alternatively, consider using sage for a different herbal note.

salt

Use kosher salt for better control over seasoning. If you prefer a lower sodium option, try using a salt substitute or reduce the amount used, but be cautious not to sacrifice flavor.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will elevate the flavor more than pre-ground. If you like a bit of heat, consider adding crushed red pepper flakes for an extra kick.

lemon (sliced)

Lemon adds brightness to the dish. For a deeper flavor, consider using Meyer lemons if available. If you want a different citrus note, lime or orange slices can be a refreshing substitute.

fresh parsley (for garnish)

Fresh parsley adds color and a fresh flavor to the dish. If you don’t have parsley, cilantro or chives can be used as alternatives. For a bit of zest, consider adding lemon zest as a garnish as well.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Begin by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). This step is crucial because a properly preheated oven ensures even cooking and helps achieve that golden, crispy skin on the chicken.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Herb Mixture

    In a large mixing bowl, combine 3 tablespoons of olive oil, 4 minced garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon of dried thyme, 1 teaspoon of dried rosemary, 1 teaspoon of salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. Mix these ingredients thoroughly until well combined. Tips: Use fresh herbs if available for a more vibrant flavor. If you're new to cooking, don’t worry about being too precise with the measurements; a little more or less won’t ruin the dish.

  • Step 3: Season the Chicken

    Take your 2 lbs of chicken (whole or parts) and add it to the bowl with the herb mixture. Rub the mixture all over the chicken, ensuring every part is coated for maximum flavor. Note: If using a whole chicken, make sure to rub some of the mixture inside the cavity as well.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Potatoes

    In another bowl, toss 1.5 lbs of baby or small potatoes with a drizzle of olive oil, a pinch of salt, and a dash of pepper until they are evenly coated. This will help them crisp up while roasting.

  • Step 5: Arrange in the Roasting Pan

    Place the seasoned chicken in a roasting pan and arrange the prepared potatoes around it. This allows the flavors to meld as they cook together.

  • Step 6: Add Lemon for Flavor

    Slice one lemon and place the slices on top of the chicken and around the potatoes. The lemon will add a refreshing brightness to the dish as it roasts.

  • Step 7: Roast the Chicken and Potatoes

    Insert the roasting pan into the preheated oven and roast for about 60 minutes. Use a meat thermometer to check that the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (75°C). The potatoes should be golden and crispy. Tips: Rotate the pan halfway through cooking for even browning.

  • Step 8: Rest and Garnish

    Once cooked, remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes. This resting period allows the juices to redistribute, ensuring a moist chicken. Before serving, garnish with 2 tablespoons of freshly chopped parsley for a pop of color and flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare a whole chicken before cooking?

To prepare a whole chicken, start by removing any giblets from the cavity. Rinse the chicken under cold water and pat it dry with paper towels. This helps to achieve crispy skin during roasting. You can also season the cavity with salt, pepper, and herbs for extra flavor.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

The best way to check if chicken is fully cooked is to use a meat thermometer. Insert it into the thickest part of the chicken (usually the thigh) without touching the bone. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (75°C). If you don't have a thermometer, the juices should run clear when you cut into the chicken.

What types of potatoes are best for roasting?

Baby or small potatoes, such as Yukon Gold or red potatoes, are great for roasting. They hold their shape well and develop a nice crispy exterior. If you're using larger potatoes, consider cutting them into smaller chunks to ensure even cooking.

How can I prevent my chicken from drying out in the oven?

To prevent the chicken from drying out, make sure to rub it with olive oil and season it well. Cooking it at a high temperature (400°F) helps to seal in moisture. Additionally, letting the chicken rest for 5-10 minutes after cooking allows the juices to redistribute.

What can I do if I don’t have dried thyme or rosemary?

If you don't have dried thyme or rosemary, you can substitute them with other herbs like oregano, basil, or Italian seasoning. Fresh herbs can also be used; just double the amount since fresh herbs are less concentrated than dried.

How should I handle raw chicken to ensure kitchen safety?

Always wash your hands with soap and water before and after handling raw chicken. Use separate cutting boards for raw meat and vegetables to prevent cross-contamination. Clean any surfaces that come into contact with raw chicken with hot, soapy water.

What is the purpose of adding lemon slices to the chicken?

Adding lemon slices not only enhances the flavor of the chicken but also helps to tenderize the meat as it cooks. The acidity from the lemon can brighten the overall dish and adds a lovely aroma.

Can I prepare the chicken and potatoes ahead of time?

Yes! You can marinate the chicken with the herb mixture and toss the potatoes in oil and seasonings a few hours in advance. Just cover and refrigerate them until you're ready to cook, which can enhance the flavors.

What should I do if my potatoes are not crispy?

To achieve crispy potatoes, make sure they are well-coated in oil and spread out in a single layer on the roasting pan. If they’re overcrowded, they’ll steam instead of roast. If they're still not crispy, you can broil them for a few minutes at the end of cooking.

How do I properly garnish my dish with parsley?

To garnish with parsley, simply chop fresh parsley leaves finely and sprinkle them over the chicken and potatoes just before serving. This adds a pop of color and freshness to your dish.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free and can be made dairy-free by ensuring no butter is used in the preparation. For those following a low-carb or keto diet, consider substituting the potatoes with roasted cauliflower or a medley of non-starchy vegetables like zucchini and bell peppers. For a whole30 or paleo option, ensure the olive oil is of high quality and free from additives. Additionally, this dish can be made with skinless chicken parts for a leaner option.

Pairings

This Savory Roasted Chicken pairs beautifully with a crisp Sauvignon Blanc or a light-bodied Chardonnay. For a red option, consider a Pinot Noir, which complements the savory herbs without overpowering the dish. For a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling lemon-infused water or herbal iced tea would work well. As for sides, consider serving with steamed green beans or a fresh garden salad with a vinaigrette to balance the richness of the chicken and potatoes.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Savory Roasted Chicken and Herbed Potato Medley on a large rustic platter for a family-style meal. Arrange the chicken in the center with the roasted potatoes surrounding it, garnished with fresh parsley for a pop of color. Offer a side of homemade gravy or a simple garlic aioli for dipping. For a more elegant presentation, carve the chicken into pieces and arrange them on individual plates with a portion of potatoes, a lemon wedge, and a sprinkle of parsley. Ensure the dish is served warm, ideally at a temperature between 140°F and 160°F (60°C - 70°C) for optimal flavor and enjoyment.

#

Savory Roasted Chicken and Herbed Potato Medley

75 min
$15
600 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeDairy-Free

Cuisine:

AmericanMediterranean

Course:

Main CourseDinner

Tags:

EasyComfort FoodFamily Meal

Description

A comforting, flavorful meal featuring juicy roasted chicken paired with crispy herbed potatoes.

Ingredients

  • chicken (whole or parts): 2 lbs
  • potatoes (baby or small): 1.5 lbs
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • garlic (minced): 4 cloves
  • dried thyme: 1 teaspoon
  • dried rosemary: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
  • lemon (sliced): 1
  • fresh parsley (for garnish): 2 tablespoons
